SENT.plain: We report antiphospholipid antibody positivity in three of a consecutive series of 23 children presenting partial epileptic seizures
There was no clinical or serological evidence of systemic lupus erythematosus or other connective-tissue disease
Neither computed tomography nor magnetic resonance imaging revealed ischemic alteration
The presence of antiphospholipid antibodies in 3/23 children may indicate that immune-mediated neuronal damage could be a pathogenetic mechanism for partial epilepsy
